Description: Fragment of floor and lower part of rim of North Ionian pottery plate; slipped cream; low ring foot with two deep grooves preserved to its inside; raised band at edge of floor below rim; interior: whitish slip; traces remaining of rim decoration; on the band, frieze of alternating solid squares and cross-and-dot motifs separated by triple verticals; at edge of floor, black band with added white band; outside worn, part at least glazed; grooves alternately glazed and reserved on underside.
Curator's comments: The piece is very close to 1888,0601.551 and 560, but the dimensions very enough to show it is not from the same plate.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1084)
